intro: Siphonandra elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf siphonandra, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by legume-like pods containing seeds. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates.
